For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Neuroscience</title>   <subtitle>Recognised internationally for our world-class research portfolio and excellence in teaching, Nottingham's School of Life Sciences contains one of the leading neuroscience divisions in the UK. We provide excellent teaching informed by cutting-edge research and our modular system allows a choice of subject areas and themes within a neuroscience degree.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/neuroscience.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/neuroscience.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T01:22:00Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/neuroscience.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Neuroscience BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/bsc-neuroscience.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Neuroscience is the study of the brain, spinal cord and peripheral nervous system in terms of its normal function and dysfunction associated with central nervous system disorders. As such, neuroscience encompasses a wide range of disciplines, including behaviour, genetics, and cellular and molecular biology, as well as physiology.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-10T16:31:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/bsc-neuroscience.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Neuroscience MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/msci-neuroscience.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Neuroscience is the study of the brain, spinal cord and peripheral nervous system in terms of its normal function and dysfunction associated with central nervous system disorders. As such, neuroscience encompasses a wide range of disciplines, including behaviour, genetics, and cellular and molecular biology, as well as physiology.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:01:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-11T13:21:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/neuroscience/msci-neuroscience.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
